Package RautSoft.util

This package contains various utility methods including various Probability Distributions Printing of arrays.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
nrutil Various methods and classes constructed to make use of Numerical Recipes
nrutil.pBoolean A construct to pass primitive object to a method
nrutil.pDouble A construct to pass primitive object to a method
nrutil.pInt A construct to pass primitive object to a method
ProbabilityDistributions Probability density and distribution functions
RautSoftUtil Various static methods for printing of an array, Jama Matrix and other utilities.
 

Exception Summary
RautSoftException  
 

Package RautSoft.util Description

This package contains various utility methods including various Probability Distributions Printing of arrays.

Usage Example

import Jama.*;

        import static RautSoft.util.ProbabilityDistributions.*;

        public class RautSoftUtilEX {
    
        public static void main(String[] argsv){
        //Following are from class ProbabilityDistributions
        double x=1-2*(.5*erff(1.96/Math.sqrt(2)) );
        System.out.println("Phi(1.96) = 1-2*(.5*erff(1.96/Math.sqrt(2)) ) =" + x);
        System.out.println("(1-NormalCDF(-1.96) ) = " + (1-NormalCDF(-1.96) ) );
        System.out.println("NormalCDF(1.96) = " + NormalCDF(1.96)  );
        System.out.println("NormalPDF(0) = " + NormalPDF(0)  );
        System.out.println("NormalCDFInverse(.95) = " + NormalCDFInverse(.95)  );
        System.out.println("NormalCDFInverse(.975) = " + NormalCDFInverse(.975)  );
        System.out.println("CDF of Student t distribution: StudentsTCDF(2.571,5 ) = " + StudentsTCDF(2.571,5 )) ;
        System.out.println("CDF of F distribution: FCDF(5.82, 3,20) = " + FCDF(5.82, 3,20) );
        System.out.println("CDF of chi-square distribution: ChiSquareCDF(14.0671, 7) = " + ChiSquareCDF(14.0671, 7) );
        }
        }

Output of the above program

        Phi(1.96) = 1-2*(.5*erff(1.96/Math.sqrt(2)) ) =0.04999578370709434
        (1-NormalCDF(-1.96) ) = 0.9750021081464528
        NormalCDF(1.96) = 0.9750021081464528
        NormalPDF(0) = 0.3989422804014327
        NormalCDFInverse(.95) = 1.6448536624925976
        NormalCDFInverse(.975) = 1.959963928147398
        CDF of Student t distribution: StudentsTCDF(2.571,5 ) = 0.9750126826844534
        CDF of F distribution: FCDF(5.82, 3,20) = 0.00499124086021868
        CDF of chi-square distribution: ChiSquareCDF(14.0671, 7) = 0.9499992957862138
